messages.message: Is there a difference between how API and non-api endpoints are created in a way that would affect multipart file uploads?
ideally we should only do multi-part fileuploads using one endpoint. Not aware of doing it in two different flask servers: cc: @Heymian @achao
yep, the endpoint I am familiar with is in webapp `filesystems.py`
This is for @Jessicaâ€™s work on profile photo uploads, so not associated with the Instabase FS

Or even just in a way that would affect how the body of a request is sent to the backend - I'm getting weird behavior where a request looks different when it's received in webapp versus api-server and Aaron is helping me debug it
is this related to a specific endpoint?
I tried moving the POST handler of ProfileView in account.py (which I had working with my frontend changes) into api/v1, and the `form` and `files` fields of the request object are now empty arrays
